data.title: On Android release build performance issue
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1, 3.15
- devices test on: S6, Sony xperia z1 
- developing environments
   - NDK version: 13rb
   
On Android release build performance is pretty bad as compared to debug build. How do I fix it?

Thanks

data.title: Disable URL encoding in Cocos2dxDownloader.java (Android inconsistency)
data.body:
The current Apple Implementation of Downloader uses the following code (CCDownloader-apple.mm):

`    NSURL *url = [NSURL URLWithString:[NSString stringWithUTF8String:urlStr]];`

Which does not perform any URL encoding of a URL given. This is consistent with all HttpRequests sent through HttpClient.

However the default state of the loopj AsyncHttpClient appears to encode URLs meaning that when a pre-encoded URL is passed (as per compatibility with HttpRequest and apple implementation) it is double-encoded and mangled.

This pull request proposes to disable url encoding for android to make it consistent with other implementations, however this seems like it would be a breaking change for anyone with platform-specific workarounds in place for Android. is this acceptable?

Technically this breaks backward compatibility, however it is breaking compatibility with an inconsistent implementation.

data.title: If you face on a problem about no elf execute libray ,there was an answer

- cocos2d-x version:all
- devices test on:
- developing environments

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Make android project.Then compile successfully.Run with no library error.
This problem was casued by the android version.You could modify the android version to below 23.
The other not verified answer was modifying the Application.mk to "APP_STL := gnustl_shared"

data.title: Lua add modules directory
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: git
- devices test on: linux mint 18.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create directory `lib` in `src`
2. Add this code to `main.lua`:

 

    package.path = ';./lib/?.lua;./lib/?/init.lua'
3. Create this structure in lib:

 

    lib +
         |- test1.lua
         |- test2 +
                      |- init.lua
4. For some reasons I can do `require 'test1'`, but can't `require 'test2'`.
How can I make possible to load `test2` in cocos2d-x?  
P.S.: it works in pure lua.

data.title: SIGSEGV on exit
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: git
- devices test on: linux mint 18.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. build any game
2. launch and close it

I found a strange bug with cocos: it always crashes on exit. No matter which project, which language, which way to close - always segfault on exit. Some information from gdb:

    ...
    Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
    0x00007f7c4eae1a30 in ?? ()
    (gdb) continue
    Continuing.
    
    Program terminated with signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
    The program no longer exists.

data.title: correct usage of reference count of LabelAtlas
data.body: I found `LabelNewTest` will crash in the test case: `LabelTTFCJKWrappingTest`. Then i check the commit history, found it is caused by https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/17756. After doing more research, i found `FontAtlasCache::getFontAtlasXXX()` has bad logic in reference count usage, so send this PR to fix it. This PR also fix crash of the test case.

data.title: LabelTTF's ugly stroke on web platform
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- devices test on: MacBook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Mid 2014)
- developing environments
   - browser type and version: Google Chrome 59.0.3071.115 (Official Build) (64-bit)

I am encountering a problem enabling stroke for my cc.LabelTTF object in my web game. This issue only exists after I upgraded my project from Cocos2d-x 3.10 to Cocos2d-x 3.13.1. 

You can see the problem right in the original js-test project by choosing Label Test section. Here is the result after I added some texts which I used in my game. I did some slight modifications in LabelTest.js on stroke size and stroke color, just to show the problem more clearly.

P/s: I tried upgrading cocos2d-x to the newest version 3.15.1 but the problem still exists.

![screen shot 2017-07-28 at 11 38 27 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13411328/28703026-474c47ce-738b-11e7-9801-b9ecee49c66b.png)

data.title: Uploading game without engine copy
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1

I want to write some test for my library and upload them into github repo. I don't need engine copy, because I always will test on fresh version downloaded by script. Is there a way to publish copy of source code (project) without engine's copy?

data.title: fix crash because of error offset
Add Chipmunk JS binding for segmentQuery
data.body:
This registers the Chipmunk `segmentQuery` function on the JSB `cpSpace` object. Everything else was already set up, but the function isn't registered for some reason. Please let me know if there is a specific reason for this to not be there. Maybe there's some other API for this that I've missed?

I've tested this on an iOS 10.3.3 device, I unfortunately don't have any other devices to test this on.

data.title: Broken touch processing after widget removed and added again
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:3.15+
- devices test on: mac, ios, android
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. add button to scene
2. retain it
3. remove it from scene
4. add it to scene again

button will by not clickable

commit that broke this
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/commit/95baff70869c130922fe3fe5cf46d86fe5524e0c

_eventDispatcher->removeEventListenersForTarget(this);

but on adding button again _touchEnabled is true but listener will by not added again

data.title: FontAtlas::prepareLetterDefinitions's memory leak.
[ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
How add library Protobuf-lite
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.3.15
- devices test on: 
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r15b
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  I tried to add a library by changing the Android.mk file. 
 ```
LOCAL_PATH := $(call my-dir)

    include $(CLEAR_VARS)

$(call import-add-path,$(LOCAL_PATH)/../../cocos2d)
$(call import-add-path,$(LOCAL_PATH)/../../cocos2d/external)
$(call import-add-path,$(LOCAL_PATH)/../../cocos2d/cocos)
$(call import-add-path,$(LOCAL_PATH)/../../cocos2d/cocos/audio/include)
```

data.title: I cannot remove tiles on FastTMXLayer in the screen
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:3.15.1
- devices test on:iOS
- developing environments
   - NDK version:r14b
   - Xcode version:8.3.3

http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/i-cannot-remove-tiles-on-fasttmxlayer-in-the-screen/38122

I want to remove tiles on experimental::TMXLayer in my game.
When I try to remove tiles, tiles outside the screen are removed, but tiles in the screen remain without being removed.

Steps to Reproduce:
https://github.com/noprops/TileMapTest
Run the above demonstration on iOS device and press "Remove Tiles" button.
I want to remove all water tiles, but tiles in the screen are not removed.
As you scroll through the screen, you will notice that tiles outside the screen are deleted.
Even if you press the button many times afterwards, the remaining tiles will not disappear.

data.title: There is some crash happend. CCScheduler.cpp:721 pauseTarget
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13
- devices test on: very much
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r10d

Steps to Reproduce: no

I recive some crash log from "Bugly" (http://bugly.qq.com)

In CCScheduler.cpp:721

```c++
void Scheduler::pauseTarget(void *target)
{
    CCASSERT(target != nullptr, "target can't be nullptr!");

    // custom selectors
    tHashTimerEntry *element = nullptr;
    HASH_FIND_PTR(_hashForTimers, &target, element);  // crash happend at this line, this line number is 721
    if (element)
    {
        element->paused = true;
    }
```
